member.name: IAMAnalogVideoDecoder.get_AvailableTVFormats

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The get_AvailableTVFormats method retrieves the analog video formats that the decoder supports.

member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives a bitwise enumeration.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The get_HorizontalLocked method determines whether the horizontal sync is locked.

param.name: plLocked
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives one of the following values.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

listheader.description: The device does not support this method.

member.name: IAMAnalogVideoDecoder.get_NumberOfLines

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. The get_NumberOfLInes method retrieves the number of scan lines in the video signal.

member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives the number of scan lines in the video signal. This is generally by 525 lines for NTSC and 625 lines for PAL or SECAM.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

listheader.description: The device does not support this method.

The get_OutputEnable method determines whether the video port bus is enabled.

param.name: plOutputEnable
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives one of the following values.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

The get_TVFormat method retrieves the current analog video format.

member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives a member of the enumeration, indicating the analog video format.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or an error code otherwise.

The get_VCRHorizontalLocking method indicates whether the decoder is expecting video from a tape source or a broadcast source.

param.name: plVCRHorizontalLocking
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives one of the following values.

listheader.description: The decoder is expecting video from a broadcast source.
The decoder is expecting video from a tape source.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

listheader.description: The device does not support this method.

The put_OutputEnable method enables or disables the video port bus.

param.name: lOutputEnable
param.para: Specifies whether the bus is enabled. Use one of the following values.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

listheader.description: The device does not support this method.

param.para: Specifies one of the following values.

listheader.description: The video is from a broadcast source.
The video is from a tape source.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The IAMAnalogVideoDecoder interface sets and retrieves information about the analog-to-digital conversion process in a video capture filter.

The WDM Video Capture filter exposes this interface if the device is an analog video capture device. Applications can use this interface to control aspects of the analog decoding process, such as the analog video format and the horizontal sync lock.
